2: the icon hash of the app
4: an array of rpc origin urls, if rpc is enabled
5: when false only app owner can join the app's bot to guilds
6: when true the app's bot will only join upon completion of the full oauth2 code grant flow
7: the url of the app's terms of service
8: the url of the app's privacy policy
9: partial user object containing info on the owner of the application
10: deprecated and will be removed in v11. An empty string.
11: the hex encoded key for verification in interactions and the GameSDK's GetTicket
12: if the application belongs to a team, this will be a list of the members of that team
13: if this application is a game sold on Discord, this field will be the guild to which it has been linked
14: if this application is a game sold on Discord, this field will be the id of the "Game SKU" that is created, if exists
15: if this application is a game sold on Discord, this field will be the URL slug that links to the store page
16: the application's default rich presence invite cover image hash
18: up to 5 tags describing the content and functionality of the application
19: settings for the application's default in-app authorization link, if enabled
20: the application's default custom authorization link, if enabled
21: the application's role connection verification entry point, which when configured will render the app as a verification method in the guild role verification configuration

0: Indicates if an app uses the Auto Moderation API
1: Intent required for bots in 100 or more servers to receive presence_update events
2: Intent required for bots in under 100 servers to receive presence_update events, found on the Bot page in your app's settings
3: Intent required for bots in 100 or more servers to receive member-related events like guild_member_add. See the list of member-related events under GUILD_MEMBERS
4: Intent required for bots in under 100 servers to receive member-related events like guild_member_add, found on the Bot page in your app's settings. See the list of member-related events under GUILD_MEMBERS
5: Indicates unusual growth of an app that prevents verification
6: Indicates if an app is embedded within the Discord client (currently unavailable publicly)
7: Intent required for bots in 100 or more servers to receive message content
8: Intent required for bots in under 100 servers to receive message content, found on the Bot page in your app's settings
9: Indicates if an app has registered global application commands

0: the scopes to add the application to the server with
1: the permissions to request for the bot role
